Action.Name: INIPlus.CreateSection
Action.Description: (OPTIONAL) Although sections are created automatically when a value's attribute or data is specified, sometimes it is desirable to create blank sections. This function does just that.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The name of the section to create.

Arg.Name: Attribute
Arg.Description: The section's attribute. This can be left blank.

Action.Name: INIPlus.CreateFromINI
Action.Description: Creates an INIPlus file from an INI file.

Arg.Name: INIPlus File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to create.

Arg.Name: INI File
Arg.Description: The INI file to be copied.

Action.Name: INIPlus.ChangeSectionName
Action.Description: Changes the name of an existing section.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Old Name
Arg.Description: The name of the existing section.

Arg.Name: New Name
Arg.Description: The name to which the section will be changed.

Action.Name: INIPlus.CopySection
Action.Description: Copies an existing section with all attributes, values and value attributes to a new section.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Old Section
Arg.Description: The name of the existing section.

Arg.Name: Copied Section
Arg.Description: The name to call the newly-copied section.

Action.Name: INIPlus.CountSections
Action.Description: Counts the number of sections and returns the number.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Action.Name: INIPlus.CountValues
Action.Description: Counts the number of values in a given section and returns the number.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section in which to count the values.

Action.Name: INIPlus.DeleteSection
Action.Description: Deletes an existing section and all its values.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The name of the section to delete.

Action.Name: INIPlus.DeleteValue
Action.Description: Deletes a value in a specifc section.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section which contains the target value.

Arg.Name: Value
Arg.Description: The value to delete.

Action.Name: INIPlus.ExportToINI
Action.Description: Exports all data in an INIPlus file and write it to an ini file. All attributes can be included as comments in the new ini file.

Arg.Name: INIPlus File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to be copied.

Arg.Name: INI File
Arg.Description: The ini file to create.

Arg.Name: Include Attributes
Arg.Description: Whether or not to include the all attributes in the INIPlus file as comments in the new INI file.

Action.Name: INIPlus.GetSectionAttribute
Action.Description: Retrieves the attribute of the given section.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The name of the section whose attribute to get.

Action.Name: INIPlus.GetSectionNames
Action.Description: Gets the names of all sections and returns them in a numerically indexed table.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Action.Name: INIPlus.GetValue
Action.Description: Gets the data of a given value.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section which contains the value where the target data is stored.

Arg.Name: Value
Arg.Description: The value which contains the target data.

Action.Name: INIPlus.GetValueAttribute
Action.Description: Gets the attribute of a given value.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section which contains the value where the target attribute is stored.

Arg.Name: Value
Arg.Description: The value which contains the target attribute.

Action.Name: INIPlus.GetValueNames
Action.Description: Get all value names from a specified section and returns them in a numerically indexed table.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section in which to count values.

Action.Name: INIPlus.ReadToTable
Action.Description: Reads the contents of an INIPlus file and returns a table containing two sub tables.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Action.Name: INIPlus.SectionDoesExist
Action.Description: Determines whether or not a section exists.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section for which to search.

Action.Name: INIPlus.SetSectionAttribute
Action.Description: Set or changes the the attribute of a given section. If the section does not exist it will be created.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section in which to set the attribute.

Arg.Name: Attribute
Arg.Description: The attribute text.

Action.Name: INIPlus.SetValueAttribute
Action.Description: Set or changes the attribute of a given value. If the section or value does not exist then it will be created.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section which contains the value for which to set the attribute.

Arg.Name: Value
Arg.Description: The value for which to set the attribute.

Arg.Name: Attribute
Arg.Description: The attribute text.

Action.Name: INIPlus.SetValueData
Action.Description: Set or changes the data of a given value. If the section or value does not exist then it will be created.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section which contains the value for which to set the data.

Arg.Name: Value
Arg.Description: The value for which to set the data.

Arg.Name: Data
Arg.Description: the data text. This can be multi-line.

Action.Name: INIPlus.SetValueAttributeAndData
Action.Description: Set or changes the attribute and data of a given value. If the section or value does not exist then it will be created.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section which contains the value for which to set the attribute and data.

Arg.Name: Value
Arg.Description: The value for which to set the attribute and data.

Arg.Name: Attribute
Arg.Description: The attribute text.

Arg.Name: Data
Arg.Description: The data text.

Action.Name: INIPlus.ShowErrors
Action.Description: Set this to true to see any occuring erros with INIPlus actions.

Arg.Name: Show Errors
Arg.Description: Whether or not to show errors created by syntax problems in INIPlus functions. This is good for trouble shooting.

Action.Name: INIPlus.ValueDoesExist
Action.Description: Determines whether or not a value exists.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The INIPlus file to access.

Arg.Name: Section
Arg.Description: The section which contains the target value.

Arg.Name: Value
Arg.Description: The value for which to search.

Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns the number of sections in a INIPlus file. If an error occurs then -1 is returned.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns the number of values in a given section in an INIPlus file. If an error occurs then -1 is returned.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: A string containing the attribute. If there is no attribute or an error occurs then a blank string ("") is returned.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: A numerically indexed tables whose values are the sections names.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: A string containing the value's data. If there is no data or an error occurs then a blank string ("") is returned.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: A string containing the value's attribute. If there is no attribute or an error occurs then a blank string ("") is returned.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: A numerically indexed tables whose values are the value names.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription:
Returns a table containing two sub tables. If no data exists or an error occurs then nil is returned.
The first table is indexed by section and value names.
tData["My Section"].ID tData["My Section"].Name tData["My Section"].Attribute tData["My Section"].Values["My Value"].ID tData["My Section"].Values["My Value"].Name tData["My Section"].Values["My Value"].Attribute tData["My Section"].Values["My Value"].Data
The second table is indexed by numbers but contains the same data as the first table.
tData[1].ID tData[1].Name tData[1].Attribute tData[1].Values[1].ID tData[1].Values[1].Name tData[1].Values[1].Attribute tData[1].Values[1].Data
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns true if a section exists and false if a section does not. If an error occurs then nil is returned.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns true if a value exists and false if it does not. If an error occurs then nil is returned.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns the number of values in a given section in a INIPlus file. If an error occurs then -1 is returned.
Action.Note: The INIPlus format IS case sensitive. The escape character (for manually editing an INIPlus file) is a carrot "^". Comments can placed anywhere outside of sections but must still escape with a carrot "^" when using function symbols ([, ], <, >, |, =, ", ')

Extended.Name: INIPlus
Extended.Description: A human-readable file format using some combined features of INI and XML.
Extended.Author: Centauri Soldier
Extended.InstallNotes: Place the "INIPlus" folder in your "AutoPlay Media Studio\Plugins\Actions" folder
